text: you know we're talking about like the
platonic ideal of software that lasts
that's that's an engineering thing like
the business views your code as a
disposable thing and it's not this like
elegant statue that's going to be
lasting in a long time so this is this
is more for like the love of of software
the the making something that lasts but
oh yeah from the business perspective
they don't care
that's fine like that's that's that's
completely fine and sometimes it's
smarter not to care I mean in the case
of a startup when you don't have an
established business that you know is
going to generate Revenue if you're
building software that lasts you're
building the wrong thing because the
business might not even last right so at
a certain point it's foolish to build a
statue
when you're trying to change the thing

and then you're like okay this thing
that I built not to last turns out the

and it's going to last when do I know
that's the case how do I know when to

are hard problems and oftentimes we err
on the side of moving fast and breaking
things and end up with systems that are

difficult to change and end up you know
